content.question: The current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> in a wire is given as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> by the equation <math alttext="I of t equals A t cubed, plus B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>B</mi></math>, where <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> are constants. Which expression is equal to the amount of charge that passes through a cross-sectional area of the wire from time <math alttext="t sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> to <math alttext="t sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 A times, open parenthesis, t sub 2, end sub, squared, minus t sub 1, end sub, squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msubsup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msup><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="A times, open parenthesis, t sub 2, end sub, cubed, minus t sub 1, end sub, cubed, close parenthesis, plus B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msubsup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn><mn>3</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn><mn>3</mn></msubsup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>B</mi></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator A times, open parenthesis, t sub 2, end sub, minus t sub 1, end sub, close parenthesis, raised to the 4 power, and denominator 4, end fraction, plus B times, open parenthesis, t sub 2, end sub, minus t sub 1, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>A</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>4</mn></msup></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>B</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator A times, open parenthesis, t sub 2, end sub, raised to the 4 power, minus t sub 1, end sub, raised to the 4 power, close parenthesis, and denominator 4, end fraction, plus B times, open parenthesis, t sub 2, end sub, minus t sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msubsup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></msubsup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>B</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator A times, open parenthesis, t sub 2, end sub, raised to the 4 power, minus t sub 1, end sub, raised to the 4 power, close parenthesis, and denominator 4, end fraction, plus B times, open parenthesis, t sub 2, end sub, minus t sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mrow><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msubsup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn><mn>4</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></msubsup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mi>B</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
